thread.title: Thai squad formally asks for Alyssa Valdez's services
thread.title_full: Thai squad formally asks for Alyssa Valdez's services

title: Thai squad formally asks for Alyssa Valdez's services
text:
Sportshub ( Leaderboard Top ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 Thai squad formally asks for Alyssa Valdez's services By Joey Villar (philstar.com) | Updated January 5, 2017 - 2:54pm Alyssa Valdez | Philstar.com/ Efigenio Toledo IV 
MANILA, Philippines – 3BB Nakornnont, a club team in the Thailand Volleyball League, has recently asked permission from the Larong Volleyball sa Pilipinas Inc. to allow Alyssa Valdez to suit up with them in their coming tournament this year. 
"Yes, we received a letter from them," said LVPI president Peter Cayco of Arellano University. "We're now in the process of contacting Alyssa Valdez to validate and then process her papers." 
Valdez is currently vacationing in the United States but she is expected to return to the country Friday. 
Before she left, Valdez said she was honored and happy to receive an invitation from the former Thailand League champion last December. 
“I was asked to return on January 15 and I hope to make the team for the competitions on January 29,” said Valdez in a statement. 
While Valdez has insisted that nothing is final yet, the Shakey’s V-League superstar and former three-time UAAP MVP has expressed enthusiasm over the prospect of becoming the first Filipino player to see action professionally overseas in recent memory. Sportshub ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 
“Honestly, I’m really so happy because I was given another opportunity to focus exclusively on volleyball again,” she said. Sportshub ( Article MRec ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1
